posts.body: Fix things ASAP, people are already migrating to the other chan.

>>69d6732a-c888-4478-ba49-7df5473a02d2
Because of ZeroID. 08chan was much more alive before this change. Userbase will probably go somewhere else, if this is not fixed in time.

In practical terms, many users have no idea what they need to do, since there is no clear info on front page and not everyone knows ZeroNet, ZeroID and all the other tech stuff required for basic posting. Another problem, some even think stuff is posted, while in reality it isn't, if they still use old 08chan ID.

Time is of essence, people will rush back to 8ch, especially if it comes online before problems here are fixed. Funny enough, 8ch tech admin (twitter.com/CodeMonkeyZ) is silent since Aug 7, despite promising prompt resolution.

Thanks for updates! Temporarily enabling 08chan certs helped a lot with stuck downloads. '''It should be done at least a few more times for all people who were not around, until some more solid solution is in place.'''

>>62750d65-7b75-4bba-a08c-e87349d87ade
I want to seed everything from a clear install - what's the best way to get all files as fast as possible? I am using VPN+Tor, but can go over VPN as well, if that is faster.

>>14877b1d-f1ba-4ef2-94c4-bd2c4f993538
That's true. Was wondering if the content will load faster compared to Tor. From various posts it seems Tor gets less trackers and also certain relays may block you in case of too many p2p connections, so VPN is best for downloading.

>>8767fcaf-6249-4b35-acd2-1c93cb7949c3
Great! :)
Any special config or just clean install? I made a new VeraCrypt container to download and seed the entire 08chan, but didn't download much yet.

>>3b6567f0-ca0e-47b6-a34b-da41a2e55b17
Yes, please share the tracker list.
I am using this one:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o/

>>2a46d51d-dbe6-4afb-86df-14282cf23793
Thanks! Will finish my setup now and start downloading.

My OPTIONAL FILES stats:
Downloaded: '''28229 MB'''
Total: '''39449 MB'''

It seems very slow now, at ~3100 files (~10 GB) left ... How to download the rest? When speeds were normal it was downloading pretty fast, now it takes forever to get a few files.

>>c6c9c5ed-8d6c-4c5c-a5bd-2b6ebd140a9f

Received: '''31499.14MB'''
Optional: 28242.83MB / 39482.21M

>>538c858d-32f9-4b87-af1e-c7cebc3de7f1
Wonder if it would make sense to collect all the files possible and offer them as one big download for those who want to seed. Maybe board owner has more files. Then again, when files are seeded download is fast in any case.

FOX News mentioned it
20190814 08:46 EDT segment
==Board owner==, why is this antifa/JIDF thread even stickied? It's not an announcement nor does it provide any relevant info.
==BO==, you could you please unstick 'Why don't Antifaniggers or JIDF...' thread? It shows on top and obscures vital info from this thread when it is bumped up.

Installed new version (201908141821) on top of '''40 GB''' of content. Seems to be great, no issues so far, memory leaks seem to be gone. Should be even better when production build is released, instead of a debug one.

Tor Browser (TBB): image and video posting - no issues. Thumbnails for videos will appear as white boxes if you leave it at default settings. You need to sacrifice a bit of security and set certain `resistFingerprinting` settings in `about:config` to '''false''', just like it was the case for image posting with the older version of Millchan, or simply use some other browser. The same goes for performance, try different browsers and see if there is a difference. There will be some more fixes in the future, which will make Millchan on TBB faster.
More: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1565661379_13Gu27WksygoMQzLpktTGzZTHumTN5pce1/Tor+Image+Posting

>>80b8670e-cbd2-4454-a96c-abdbb597476a
It's not stickied anymore, thanks! :)

>>7da72850-d239-4428-a019-c21bcc45deae
I got similar. Right now ~33 GB OPTIONAL seems to be max available, with Tor or without. Data dir size is around 40 GB, which includes optional + all the rest.

>>e5fdfbf3-1d6e-4eeb-9f0c-02dd83e3b5a6
No issues so far. Last 50 is a must for long threads, you can also edit :nn (any number) at the end of the URL to get the desired number of posts.

Since this is a debug build, it should be replaced with 'Production build' once it's available.

>3. Ability to store the board on a spare partition with plausible deniability to run it from Tails

You can do something similar with encrypted partitions or containers. I am running and seeding everything via Tor from VeraCrypt (https://www.veracrypt.fr) volume. Highly recommended. It is also portable if you put it on external disk.

>>daee6313-9c0b-4b5a-a357-c28575b9c46a
>>74d8d3c3-54b5-46ea-a544-375d18ab8d7b
Number of peers also depends on trackers/peers, sometimes it can show lower number which fixes itself after more info is available.

4400+ right now. It goes up and down, depends on the time of the day, increases during weekends. Record number was 11000+, so there definitely is potential.

>>d7a7282f-e51e-4ab4-b4cc-939e682752e4
4675 atm, 15/116 trackers, it varies, can be 40+ connected too. I am using Tor plus custom tracker list, without udp trackers. Tor itself is not required to get more peers, must be config or something.

Get trackers here:
Syncronite: http://127.0.0.1:43110/15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o/
https://torrents.io/tracker-list/

>>4f4945b8-c1a4-4728-86cc-0ed68092c986
>Tor doesn't make a thumbnail for videos.
Set `privacy.resistFingerprinting` to '''false''' in `about:config`.

See this thread for more info:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1565661379_13Gu27WksygoMQzLpktTGzZTHumTN5pce1

>>a35efd5c-1a54-4f0c-8c79-4a7ba3a75553
>The problem is that if you use an encryption scheme that supports a hidden container, the powers that be will assume you did use it more often than not (although I admit it probably would be enough to subvert key disclosure law). [...]
Anything which increases security and gives more options is welcome. Otherwise, you can turn this scenario around - VeraCrypt can be used to hide your ZeroNet instance, either on file container, partition, volume, hidden volume or some spare portable drive. The data appears random and can't reveal VeraCrypt was used. It may raise some questions if you have it installed or unpacked somewhere, but they can't prove anything. For extra deniability, when containers are used, they should have some real torrent or download name which can be found online, among similar items, and you can always say you have no idea why that particular item is damaged.

In any case, people should know their rights, browsing ZeroNet is not illegal. Encryption is optional, usually a good idea if you seed a lot of stuff.

God as it is/was imagined by many religions is not the best description of any higher intelligence. Most certainly not some bearded old man judging your sex life, that's just man-made moral system, often copied from different sources.
